pageContent: I love the grind. I love the grind. I dont love the problems that come with it, but just is what it is. You get the good with the ugly and part of it, I guess.

Yeah, if Im going to coach any consulting, the consulting aspect would be ideal, but most people, I believe, say they hire me to do kitchen anyways, theyre going to consult me. Im already a consultant on directing them, on what kind of products and where to buy them and how to use it and where this product can be used and where it cant be used. I guess already they kind of get that free out of me when they hire me to do a project. Right. So that portion of it being I think Im already in next draw by me doing that keeps me from doing the other things that I may be paying attention to as well. Because not only do I consult, I actually place the product orders and I also direct everybody on which direction theyre going. Being that COVID did happen and if I did start something like this and I can charge thousands of dollars for it, boy, would that offset the downtime we have on the other projects we have. I just have to hire a project manager to take a step in my position. The problem with that is that two things. One, if youre hiring somebody like that, that is as good as you. They dont need you, they might as well start their own stuff. So replacing me with me would be very difficult.

It just all depends. Some of the bathrooms are around 35 and then get some that are more. But I would say, like, an average bathroom, like just a small bathroom, will be 15 grand. Normally its like 1530, and then if they want something extravagant, 45, 50,000.

Yeah, well, three key important aspects for me as being a sales guy, you got 3 seconds to impress somebody how you talk, how you smell, and how you look. So it depends on the person. If they look like crap, you could tell they smoke and they smell like shit, theyre not going to do any good for me. Right. In a sales position, you got to have those key elements. You got to know how to talk good, smell good, look good. From there, you got to be good on the phone. If you dont look good, you dont smell good, and you dont talk. Okay, let me say two out of the three. If you dont look good, smell good. You got to be able to talk good. Youve got to be able to have a conversation and communicate whatever youre trying to get out clear to the customer and be able to educate them. Because I noticed that a lot of these companies that were dealing with now just dont know how to educate the customer properly. And I think that would be the three key points for me because I cant work around somebody that smells like shit. Sorry, dog shit, cigarettes. I just cant work with someone like that. Two, if they dont look good, theyre 400, 500 pounds. A couple of hundred pounds is different, but when youre four or 500 pounds overweight, cant roll out of bed. I apologize if Im not saying this to hurt anybodys feelings, but if youre not taking care of yourself, youre not going to take care of what youre doing day to day in the business. So I would have to evaluate them by those three aspects.
